resources.string: "App Tracking Protection is enabled and blocking tracking attempts across your apps"
App Tracking Protection disabled. Tap to continue blocking tracking attempts.
App Tracking Protection blocked the most tracking attempts in %s
App Tracking Protection is enabled and blocking trackers across your whole device
Block app trackers on your device
One easy step for better app privacy!

We found that over 96% of popular free apps allow other companies to track your personal information, even when you’re sleeping.\n\nSee which apps we catch letting other companies track you and take back control!

App Tracking Protection detects and blocks app trackers from other companies, like when Facebook attempts to track you in a health app.\n\nIt\'s free, and you can enjoy your apps as you normally would. Working in the background, it helps protect you night and day.

App Tracking Protection is not a VPN. However, your device will recognize it as one. This is because it uses a local VPN connection to work.\n\nApp Tracking Protection is different. It never routes app data through an external server.
App Tracking Protection shows a real-time list of apps on your device that we catch trying to track you.
You can access App Tracking Protection in Settings.
App Tracking Protection disabled.\nTap to continue blocking tracking attempts across your apps.
App Tracking Protection is enabled and blocking tracking attempts across your apps.

App Tracking Protection detects and blocks app trackers from other companies, like when Facebook tries to track you in a health app. Companies may still track you in apps they own.\n\nIf an app isn\'t working as expected, try disabling protection for that app.
Protection for some apps may be disabled so that websites load normally or to resolve known issues during beta. Your custom settings won\'t change unless you restore to default settings.
App Tracking Protection is disabled Did App Tracking Protection cause a problem with your apps Report Issues
This app is known to experience issues when tracking attempts fail.
Site content in this app may not appear properly when protection is enabled.
Enabling protection sends the app\'s name to DuckDuckGo.
Why did you disable Privacy Protection for %s app?
I\'m OK being tracked in this app
Submissions are 100% anonymous and only include your selection above and the app name.
Report an Issue With an App
Your custom protection settings will update to our latest default protections. You can always change your protection settings again later.
Enabling protection sends the app\'s name to DuckDuckGo.
Select the app experiencing the issue. Your feedback really helps us improve!\n\nHave general feedback about App Tracking Protection? Use this form instead.
Please describe what happened, what you expected, and what steps led to the issue.
Were you logged in to the app when you noticed the issue?
Yes, I was logged in to the app
The problem happened when logging in
I had a problem creating a new account
The app doesn\’t require log in

string.b: Were you logged in to the app when you noticed the issue?

resources.string:
In addition to the details entered into this form, the report will contain:
• The app name
• A list of trackers blocked in the current app
• Whether whole device tracker blocking is enabled
• Version information for DuckDuckGo\'s app and blocklist
• Aggregate performance statistics about DuckDuckGo\'s app
Report sent, thanks! Your feedback helps us improve App Tracking Protection for everyone.

You\’ve probably heard about companies like Google and Facebook tracking you behind the scenes on third-party websites. But did you know they also track your personal information through apps on your device?

Over 96% of the 100 popular free Android apps we tested contained hidden third-party trackers. Of those, 87% sent data to Google and 68% sent data to Facebook. This happens even when you\’re not using your device.

Trackers in apps may have access to a lot more information than their website tracker cousins, such as your location down to which floor of a building you're on, how often you play games while at work, and when and how long you sleep each day. Even if you don't have a Google or Facebook account, for example, they can still collect data about you from your apps.

Tracking networks like Facebook and Google use these little pieces of information to build a digital profile about you. With it, tracking networks can manipulate what you see online and allow advertisers to bid on access to you based on your data.

Trackers in apps is a BIG problem for privacy. But DuckDuckGo has a solution that can help.

When enabled in the DuckDuckGo Privacy Browser app, App Tracking Protection blocks many trackers in other apps on your device, at the same time that the DuckDuckGo app blocks trackers we find on websites when you browse. These dual layers of protection reduce what tracking companies know about you overall, so you can use your apps with more peace of mind, knowing you\’re more protected.
Report a problem With an App
Keep using your device. Tracking attempts that App Tracking Protection blocks appear here.
This feature is in beta. Notice a problem with an app? Please report an issue
App Tracking Protection is disabled\nDid App Tracking Protection cause a problem with your apps? Report Issues
How does App Tracking Protection work?
App Tracking Protection blocks known app trackers from other companies, like when Facebook tries to track you in a health app. Companies may still track you in apps they own.
Does App Tracking Protection block trackers in all my apps?

Protection may be automatically disabled for certain apps, like those that load websites, so that content appears normally. For apps with known issues, this is mostly temporary as we work to improve App Tracking Protection. You can manage this protection for each app on your device in the settings.

In addition, some trackers may not be blocked because we haven't yet detected and added them to our blocklist. We are continually working to identify and protect against new trackers, so you can rest easy knowing you're getting the most up-to-date protection.

You can expect updates to our tracker list every few months. These updates will get applied on your device automatically
Why does App Tracking Protection use a VPN connection?

You’ll be asked to set up a virtual private network (VPN) connection, but you don\'t need to install a VPN app for App Tracking Protection to work.\n\nThis permission allows App Tracking Protection, which works locally on your device, to monitor network traffic so that it can block known trackers.
How is App Tracking Protection different from a VPN?

A VPN sends your data from the device to its own server, where it secures and anonymizes your data from prying eyes. However, this allows the VPN company to see your network traffic.

App Tracking Protection is different. Instead of sending your data to a VPN server, App Tracking Protection works locally on your device, sitting between your apps and the servers they talk to.

Whenever App Tracking Protection recognizes a known tracker, it blocks the tracker from sending personal information (such as your IP address, activity, and device details) off your device. All other traffic reaches its destination, so your apps work normally.
App Tracking Protection works on your device and doesn’t send your personal data off your device to DuckDuckGo.
Your App Tracking Protection Invitation is Here!
You joined the waitlist and asked us to notify you when it\'s your turn to try our App Tracking Protection feature. Tap to view your invitation.
One easy step for better app privacy!
Block trackers we find hiding in your other apps and see who was trying to track you.\nLearn more
Block trackers we find hiding in your other apps and see who was trying to track you.\n\nLearn more about the beta
We didn\'t recognise this Invite Code.
You won’t need to share any personal information to join the waitlist. You’ll secure your place in line with a timestamp that exists solely on your device so we can notify you when it’s your turn.
An error happened while joining the Waitlist, please try again later
We\'ll send you a notification when App Tracking Protection is ready for you.\n\nLearn more about the beta

Your invite to try App Tracking Protection will arrive here. Check back soon, or we can send you a notification when it’s your turn

If you noticed a problem with a specific app, you can manage protection for that app instead.
